name: Italian Pavilion at the Chicago Columbian Exhibition
obverse: Columbus, facing left, on board a ship, holding the tiller with hist left hand. His right hand is holding the hand of a female figure, pointing with her right hand to the left. Above them is a star. The edge of the medal is a compass.
reverse: The American eagle facing left at the top of the reverse. Below the eagle and inscription is the exhibition building.
reverse_inscriptions: ESPOSIZIONE UNIVERSALE CHICAGO 1893 IN MEMORIA DELL ILLUSTRE NAVIGATORE CHRISTOFORO COLOMBO.
description: This medal was made to commemorate the Chicago Columbian Exhibition held in 1893.
